    • Method Detail

      • createTypedContribution

        public Contribution createTypedContribution(ContributionTypes type)
        Retrieves existing or creates a new ContributionType entity with the provided type. It then creates a new empty Contribution entity and connects it with the type. Both changed/created entities are saved to DiscourseDB and the empty typed Contribution is returned. It then adds the new empty Contribution to the db and returns the object.
        Parameters:
        type - the value for the ContributionTyep
        Returns:
        a new empty Contribution that is already saved to the db and connected with its requested type

        public Contribution save(Contribution contrib)
        Saves the provided entity to the db using the save method of the corresponding repository
        Parameters:
        contrib - the entity to save
        Returns:
        the possibly altered entity after the save process

public Optional<Contribution> findOneByDataSource(String entitySourceId,
                                                                                                                     String entitySourceDescriptor,
                                                                                                                     String dataSetName)
        Retrieves a contribution that has a source which exactly matches the given DataSource parameters.
        Parameters:
        entitySourceId - the source id of the contribution
        entitySourceDescriptor - the entitySourceDescriptor
        dataSetName - the dataset the source id was derived from
        Returns:
        an optional contribution that meets the requested parameters

public Iterable<Contribution> findAll()
        Returns a list of all contributions in the database no matter what type they or what discourse they are part of
        Returns:
        a list of all contributions in the database

      • createDiscourseRelation

        public DiscourseRelation createDiscourseRelation(Contribution sourceContribution,
                                                 Contribution targetContribution,
                                                 DiscourseRelationTypes type)
        Creates a new DiscourseRelation of the given type between the two provided contributions. Depending on the type, the relation might be directed or not. This information should be given in the type definition. e.g. a REPLY relation would be interpreted as the target(child) being the reply to the source(parent). If a DiscourseRelation of the given type already exists between the two contributions (taking into account the direction of the relation), then the existing relation is returned. DiscourseDB does not enforce the uniqueness of these relations by default, but enforcing it in this service method will cater to most of the use cases we will see.
        Parameters:
        sourceContribution - the source or parent contribution of the relation
        targetContribution - the target or child contribution of the relation
        type - the DiscourseRelationType
        Returns:
        a DiscourseRelation between the two provided contributions with the given type that has already been saved to the database

      • createTypedContext

        public Contribution createTypedContext(ContextTypes type)
        Creates a new Contribution entity with the provided context type.
        Parameters:
        type - the context type
        Returns:
        a new Contribution of the given context type that is already saved to the db

      • addContextToContribution

        public ContributionContext addContextToContribution(Contribution contrib,
                                                    Contribution context)
        Adds the given contribution "context" as context to the given contribution "contrib". No start or end date is set for this relation.
        Parameters:
        contrib - the contribution that receives the new context
        context - the contribution serving as context for the other contribution

      • addContextToContribution

        public ContributionContext addContextToContribution(Contribution contrib,
                                                    Content context)
        Adds the given content "context" as context to the given contribution "contrib". No start or end date is set for this relation and no begin or end offset is defined to specify a span within the content.
        Parameters:
        contrib - the contribution that receives the new context
        context - the content serving as context for the other contribution

      • findOne

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               readOnly=true)
public Optional<Contribution> findOne(Long id)
        Returns a Contribution given it's primary key
        Parameters:
        Long - id the primary key of the contribution
        Returns:
        an Optional that contains the contribution if it exists
